str2: A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
In like manner, similarly, in the same way, equally. Adverb from homoios; similarly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
And, even, also, namely.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To disobey, rebel, be disloyal, refuse conformity. From apeithes; to disbelieve.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To gain, acquire, win (over), avoid loss. From kerdos; to gain.
Without, without the cooperation (or knowledge) of. A primary particle; without.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Dealing with other men, conduct, life, behavior, manner of life. From anastrepho; behavior.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
